intro: Gleditsia japonica, commonly known as Japanese honeylocust, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Japan and Korea. It features compound leaves that are typically divided into 10–20 pairs of oval, serrated leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in dense, branched clusters, followed by flat, bean-like pods that contain edible seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to various soil types. The plant has also been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
